Filter network by size of regulons

Source: R/decoupleR-pre.R
filter_regulons.Rd

Keep only sources which satisfied the condition min_size >= n <= max_size, where n denotes the number of targets per source.

filter_regulons(network, .source, min_size = 1, max_size = Inf)

Arguments

network

Tibble or dataframe with edges and it's associated metadata.
.source

Column with source nodes.
min_size

Minimum number of targets allowed per regulon.
max_size

Maximum number of targets allowed per regulon.

Value

Filtered tibble.

Examples

inputs_dir <- system.file("testdata", "inputs", package = "decoupleR")
network <- readRDS(file.path(inputs_dir, "input-dorothea_genesets.rds"))
filter_regulons(network, .source = tf, min_size = 30, max_size = 50)

#> # A tibble: 33 x 5
#>    tf    confidence target   mor likelihood
#>    <chr> <chr>      <chr>  <dbl>      <dbl>
#>  1 SMAD3 A          AHR        1          1

#>  4 SMAD3 A          BAMBI      1          1
#>  5 SMAD3 A          BGLAP      1          1
#>  6 SMAD3 A          CCND2      1          1
#>  7 SMAD3 A          CDKN1A     1          1
#>  8 SMAD3 A          COL1A1     1          1
#>  9 SMAD3 A          COL3A1     1          1
#> 10 SMAD3 A          COL6A1     1          1
#> # … with 23 more rows
